grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 瞳孔【ドウコウ】pupil (of the eye)
鰓孔【エラアナ】gill slit, pharyngeal slit
孔雀【クジャク】peafowl (incl. the male peacock, female peahen, and young peachick)
kun reading compounds: 穴【あな】hole, opening, perforation, pit, hollow, hole (in the ground, etc.), burrow, den, lair, holt, hole, deficit, shortage, missing person (in a team, meeting, etc.), vacancy, opening, flaw, well-kept secret place, upset victory (with a large payoff), pit (of a theater), hiding place, hideout, underbelly (of society, etc.)
巣穴【すあな】nesting hole, burrow, den
鰓孔【えらあな】gill slit, pharyngeal slit
